metadata.title: CVE-2023-4504 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Due to failure in validating the length provided by an attacker-crafted PPDPostScript document, CUPS and libppd are susceptible to a heap-based bufferoverflow and possibly code execution. This issue has been fixed in CUPSversion 2.4.7, released in September of 2023.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
cups-bsd - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
cups-client - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
cups-common - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
cups-core-drivers - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
cups-daemon - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
cups-ipp-utils - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
cups-ppdc - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
cups-server-common - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
libcups2 - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
libcupsimage2 - 2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.1op1-1ubuntu4.7').
libppd package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
